alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; McKean; Potter; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 13 at 5:42AM EST until January 13 at 9:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West-Southwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts of 45 to 55 mph expected, especially late this morning through early this evening. The stronger wind gusts will gradually decrease later tonight. * WHERE...Warren, McKean, Potter, Elk, Cameron and Clearfield Counties. * WHEN...Through 9 PM EST this Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The West-Southwest wind gusts will likely increase again Sunday morning, topping 45 mph for a brief period as a secondary cold front brings true arctic air into the region, possibly accompanied by a band of dangerous snow squalls and requiring another Wind Advisory.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.

area.areaDesc: Cameron; Clearfield; Elk; McKean; Potter; Warren
